example.eg: He drew a curved line on the paper to show the shape.
example.egtrans: 他在纸上画了一条曲线来表明形状。

example.eg: Plot the straight line and the circle on the same graph.
example.egtrans: 请在同一个图表中标出直线和圆圈。

example.eg: He planted a line of potatoes in the garden.
example.egtrans: 他在花园里种了一排土豆。

example.eg: The paragraph takes up ten lines in the book.
example.egtrans: 那个自然段在书里占了十行。

example.eg: The local metro has two lines; Red and Green.
example.egtrans: 当地有两条地铁线：一条红线，一条绿线。

example.eg: This bus line goes to many towns.
example.egtrans: 这条公交线路经过许多小镇。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 线路，运输线，航线, 运输公司，航运公司

example.eg: The lines on her face have increased with age.
example.egtrans: 随着年龄的增长，她脸上的皱纹也在增加。

dsense.name: line
dsense.guideword: (business: group of products) (一系列同款产品)

example.eg: The company has a product line of mobile phones for consumers.
example.egtrans: 该公司有专攻消费市场的手机产品系列。

example.eg: The line for tickets was too long, so we went somewhere else.
example.egtrans: 买票的队伍太长了，所以我们去了其他地方。

example.eg: The verse has four lines and the chorus has two.
example.egtrans: 这首歌的主歌有四行歌词，副歌有两行。

example.eg: 'Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?' is a famous line by Shakespeare.
example.egtrans: “我是否可以把你比喻成夏日？”是莎士比亚的一首名诗。

example.eg: The line between North and South Korea is heavily militarized.
example.egtrans: 朝鲜和韩国间的边防线处于高度军事化状态。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 边界, 疆界, 边防线

example.eg: I need a thick line to tie up this box.
The line got disconnected and I called her back.
example.egtrans: 电话断了，我给她打了回去。

example.eg: He tossed the line to the deepest part of the river, trying to catch a fish.
She hung the clothes on the line to dry.
example.egtrans: 她将衣服挂在绳子上晒干。

example.eg: The sewage line got blocked and overflowed.
example.egtrans: 污水管道堵住了，在往外冒水。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 管子, 管线, 管道

example.eg: Drop me a line on Tuesday and we can talk about it then.
His line of thought is consistent with that of the religious authorities.
Follow the line of the mountains and you will get to the town.
example.egtrans: 沿着群山的方向走，你会抵达那个小镇的。

example.eg: This line of kings dates back to the fourteenth century.
example.egtrans: 这一系列国王的族系可以追溯到14世纪。

example.eg: He tried to pick her up with the old line: "Have we met before?"
example.egtrans: 他试着用俗套的台词向她搭讪：“我们是不是见过？”

trans_examp.trans_cn: 准备好的借口（理由等），俗套的台词，老掉牙的借口

example.eg: The new car was admired for its beautiful curved lines.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 轮廓线条, 设计轮廓

example.eg: The three lines of defence against the enemy didn't stop them.
example.egtrans: 三条抵御敌军的防线也没能阻止他们。

example.eg: The soldiers moved forward in lines.
I will ask my line manager for her advice before talking to the boss.
example.egtrans: 和老板谈之前，我会先向业务经理寻求建议。

example.eg: The assembly line runs twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week.
example.egtrans: 装配线每周七天，每天二十四小时地运转。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 组装线, 装配线, 生产线

example.eg: She fed me some line about the dog eating her homework.
example.egtrans: 她向我撒谎说作业被狗吃了。

example.eg: He plays on the offensive line, and protects the quarterback.
example.egtrans: 他负责进攻线，保护四分卫。

example.eg: She kept forgetting the line she was supposed to say before her exit.
example.egtrans: 她老是要忘自己在离开前应该说的台词。

example.eg: A fallen tree on the line has delayed trains running between London and Manchester.
example.egtrans: 由于有棵大树倒在铁轨上，所以伦敦与曼彻斯特间的火车都遭到延误。

example.eg: The actor lost his job because he couldn't remember his lines in the movie.
Please line up here and we will see you one at a time.
example.egtrans: 请在这里排队，我们一次接见一个人。

example.eg: He lined the ball to center field and got to first base.
The teacher told the pupils to line their blank sheets of paper before writing on them.
example.egtrans: 老师要求学生在写字前先在白纸上画上线。

example.eg: Sophie lined the inside of the box with paper to protect the contents.  Line your baking tin with greaseproof paper, so the cake won't stick.
example.egtrans: 索菲在盒里垫上纸来保护里面的东西。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 做内衬, 做内垫, 衬在, 垫在

example.eg: The paper lined the sides of the box.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 衬在…里面, 做…的衬里
线上项目的，经常预算的

dsense.name: above-the-line
dsense.guideword: figurative (advertising: in mass media) (广告业：大众传媒)

dsense.name: above the line
dsense.guideword: figurative (advertising: in mass media) (广告业：大众传媒)

example.eg: He had worked on the assembly line all his life.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 生产线，流水线，装配线，组装线
流水线生产, 装配线生产

example.eg: The back line stopped the other team from scoring.
The ball crossed the back line before the player could reach it.
The backline was at the back of the stage, ready for the musicians.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 乐队演出所需要的各种设备

example.eg: Bar lines separate the measures in a piece of music.
These sales figures will be used as the baseline for the company's success in future years.
example.egtrans: 这些销售数据将作为公司未来几年成功的基准。

example.eg: The player serves from just behind the baseline.
example.egtrans: 球员在底线后发球。

example.eg: The machine monitors any deviation from the patient's baseline heart rate.
example.egtrans: 仪器会监测病人基准心率外的所有偏差值。

example.eg: They crossed the borderline into Canada around sunset.
The borderline between optimism and idealism is a hard one to draw.
The bottom line is you cannot be late for work anymore.
example.egtrans: 最重要的是，你上班不能再迟到了。

example.eg: Subtract a company's expenses from its revenue to find its bottom line.
example.egtrans: 用收入减去支出来确定公司的盈亏底线。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 盈亏一览结算线, 盈亏底线

example.eg: We will go bankrupt if we have another year with these bottom-line results.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 账本底线, 盈亏一览结算线

example.eg: The boundary line between Delaware and Pennsylvania is an arc 12 miles from the Newcastle County Courthouse.
My sister and I used tape on the floor to mark the boundary line between her side and my side of the room we shared.
Dozens of hungry people, many of them homeless, were waiting in the breadline.

dsense.name: bring [sth/sb] into line with [sth], bring [sth/sb] in line with [sth]

example.eg: The bus line operates 15 buses and employs 18 drivers.
This bus line goes past the hospital and the railway station.

dsense.name: byline, by-line
dsense.guideword: (journalism: line with author's name) (新闻报道)

example.eg: The news site has spelt this journalist's name wrong in the byline.
example.egtrans: 这家新闻网站在署名行上拼错了记者的名字。

dsense.name: centerline, center line (US), centreline, centre line (UK)
centerline, center line (US), centreline, centre line (UK)
dsense.guideword: (line painted down the middle of a road) (道路)

dsense.name: centerline, center line (US), centreline, centre line (UK)
dsense.guideword: (bisector between radio transmitters) (无线电发送器)

example.eg: The boy tried to gain the girl's attention with his chat-up lines.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 搭讪的话, 挑逗的话

example.eg: Rav pegged his shirts out on the clothesline.
example.egtrans: 拉夫把他的衬衫夹在晾衣绳上。

dsense.name: color line (US), colour line (UK), color bar (US), colour bar (UK)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 种族界限, 种族分界线
来源附注, 资料来源注解

example.eg: When Nelly first had thoughts of suicide, she called the crisis line.

dsense.name: cut in line (US), jump the queue (UK)
dsense.guideword: informal (go in front of others waiting)

example.eg: I get annoyed when people cut in line in front of me.

dsense.name: dateline
dsense.guideword: (news: line telling date and place of origin)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 新闻电讯注明日期地点的一行

example.eg: The vice president has a direct line to the president.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 直达路线, 直线电话

example.eg: The dividing line between genius and madness is thin indeed.

trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指文件上指示签名处的）点线, 虚线

dsense.name: down the line, further down the line
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (in the future) (非正式用语)

trans_examp.trans_cn: 接下来的人, 后继者, 后来人

dsense.name: draw the line
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (set a limit or restriction)

example.eg: If we allow some people to do this, then where do we draw the line?

dsense.name: draw the line at [sth], draw the line at doing [sth]
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (set a limit or restriction)

example.eg: I went out for a few beers, but I drew the line at doing shots.

dsense.name: drop [sb] a line, drop a line to [sb]

example.eg: I should drop a line to my brother because I haven't written him in a long time.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 写信给某人, 给...发消息

example.eg: The end line is located at the back of each end zone.

dsense.name: fall in line, fall into line, get into line, get in line
fall in line, fall into line, get into line, get in line
fall in line with [sth/sb], fall into line with [sth/sb], get in line with [sth/sb]

trans_examp.trans_cn: 与...保持一致, 遵守, 遵循

example.eg: This philosopher's theories fell in line with the moralistic views of his time.
Built on a fault line, the city of Ephesus was destroyed by earthquakes.

dsense.name: fine line between [sth] and [sth], a fine line between [sth] and [sth]

example.eg: There's a fine line between genius and insanity.
example.egtrans: 天才和疯子间只有一线之隔。

example.eg: Only twelve runners crossed the finishing line.
The soldier stepped up to the firing line, took aim and fired.
When things went wrong, Fred's secretary was always in the firing line.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 第一线，易受攻击的位置

example.eg: The bass was so huge it broke my fishing line and got away.
The crowd fell silent as the player stepped up to the foul line.
The soldiers' legs trembled when they heard they would be sent to the front line.  For many years, female soldiers were not allowed on the front lines.

dsense.name: front line, frontline
dsense.guideword: figurative (forefront of a field of endeavor) (比喻)

example.eg: The researchers at this university are on the frontline of medical research.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 最重要的位置, 第一线, 前沿

dsense.name: get in line, get into line

example.eg: We all got in line for the roller-coaster.
You want to take your revenge on him? You'll have to get in line!
The referee stood close to the goal line.
If you are unsatisfied with this product, please call our helpline, open 24 hours a day.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 服务热线, 求助热线

example.eg: Please hold the line while we try to connect you.
"Did your mother fall for your excuse?" "Yes! Hook, line and sinker!"

trans_examp.trans_cn: 完全地, 毫无保留地

example.eg: He drew a horizontal line from left to right across the paper.
The company runs a free hotline for customers to call at any time, day or night.
My neighbor answers calls on a suicide hotline.
The president got on the hotline to Moscow to discuss several emergency measures.
I walked home in a straight line, avoiding all the pubs I usually stop at.
It's hard work keeping a class of 5-year olds in line.
example.egtrans: 管教5岁孩子班很困难。//团队成员不守规矩，但新教练很快就把他们制服了。

example.eg: Inline roller skates are good for skating outdoors.
example.egtrans: 直排轮滑适合在户外滑冰。

example.eg: Our operating procedures are in line with state requirements.
Carrie is in line for the job, since she has worked here longer than anyone else in the team.
example.egtrans: 卡丽有资格获得这份工作，因为她在这里工作的时间比团队里任何人都要长。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 是…继承人, 是…的继任者

example.eg: Prince William is in line to succeed his father to the throne.
example.egtrans: 威廉王子是其父王位的顺位继承人。
